name: Legal support for project development & project management
description:
Legal support (contractual aspects) and support with development and conduct of clinical trials and data/sample collection projects; clarifications for further use of trial data or samples for other research projects. 
Typical examples: NDA, CDA, Coordinating Investigator Agreement, contracts w/ collaborative groups, pharmaceutical & med-device companies, trial specific agreement w/ sites, vendor agreements (e.g. CRO, pre-wholesaler, Biobank, Translational Research, MTA, Independent Response Review, Central Imaging, IWRS), fundraising institutions, consultancy agreements
Contact: Legal Affairs & Contract Management; contracts@sakk.ch

name: Regulatory services
description:
Ethical and regulatory support
- Advice: on trial categorization, on documents to be submitted, what kind of authorities to be involved 
- Preparation of documents: protocol, patient information & informed consent form, CRFs, contracts, country specific appendix, insurance documents, submission forms Swissmedic/swissethics submission forms & letters, CSR, lay summaries
- Submission to ECs, Swissmedic, FOPH:  for clinical trials - phase I-IV (IMP and/or med-device), HRO-trials and registries
Contact: Regulatory Affairs; regulatory@sakk.ch

name: Data protection advice
description: Data protection clarifications regarding data and samples use/re-use; advice on data protection specific formulations in PISICs
Contact: Legal Affairs & Contract Management; contracts@sakk.ch

name: Data sharing
description: Advice for, and provision of, oncological clinical data from clinical trials and registries for secondary use/analyses
Contact: Stefanie Hayoz, Head of Statistics; stefanie.hayoz@sakk.ch

name: Development and hosting of electronic case report forms and underlying databases
description: Development and hosting of electronic case report forms and underlying databases for data collection in oncological clinical trials and registries in secuTrial® (including ePRO) at SAKK's own/controlled premisis
Contact: Jens Schulenburg, Head of Clinical Data Management; jens.schulenburg@sakk.ch

name: Sample tracking tool (SLIMS®)
description:
Implementation of software to track sample shipments (SLIMS®) - Meet the needs of the laboratories involved in the clinical studies, generate (layout) labels, track samples. Define what samples are available and where (traceability guaranteed). 
Provide scanners (if not yet available).
Contact: Andrea Fuhrer. Head of Clinical Project Management; andrea.fuhrer@sakk.ch

name: Provision of a data collection infrastructure and interoperable core dataset
description: Provision of a data collection infrastructure and interoperable core dataset for oncological registries (SAKK registry projects), including an interface to BioMedIT (SPO-NDS in progress)
Contact: Jens Schulenburg, Head of Clinical Data Management; jens.schulenburg@sakk.ch

name: Biobanks support
description: Coordination of biobank implementation for sample storage within a clinical trial: SAKK provides support to investigators for the setup and use of biobanks at research centers.
Contact: Andrea Fuhrer. Head of Clinical Project Management; andrea.fuhrer@sakk.ch

name: Sample shipment logistical support
description: Ensuring and arranging smooth transport of samples for the biobank (logistical support, beyond SLIMS)
Contact: Andrea Fuhrer. Head of Clinical Project Management; andrea.fuhrer@sakk.ch

name: Development of data validation/cleaning procedures
description: Development of data validation/cleaning procedures (Data Management Plan and Data Validation Plan) for oncological clinical trials and registries.
Contact: Jens Schulenburg, Head of Clinical Data Management; jens.schulenburg@sakk.ch

name: Conduct of data validation/cleaning procedures
description: Conduct of data validation/cleaning procedures with the help of manual and electronic checks (secuTrial®, SAS®) for oncological clinical trials and registries.
Contact: Jens Schulenburg, Head of Clinical Data Management; jens.schulenburg@sakk.ch

name: Conduct of clinical trials
description: Comprehensive support and services for the conduct of oncological clinical trials (full service)
Contact: Andrea Fuhrer. Head of Clinical Project Management; andrea.fuhrer@sakk.ch

name: Conduct of registry projects and non-interventional studies
description: Comprehensive site support and services for the conduct of oncological registry  projects and non-interventional studies
Contact: Andrea Fuhrer. Head of Clinical Project Management; andrea.fuhrer@sakk.ch

name: Data monitoring
description: Risked-based on-site and remote data monitoring support for clinical trials in oncology
Contact: Luzia Steiner, Head of Monitoring; luzia.steiner@sakk.ch

name: Facility audits
description: Review and qualification of sample processing/ storage at trial sites and/or central lab
Contact: Quality Assurance; quality@sakk.ch

name: Statistical design
description: Statistical design for clinical trials and registries, including input in protocol and development of statistical analysis plan
Contact: Stefanie Hayoz, Head of Statistics; stefanie.hayoz@sakk.ch

name: Statistical analyses and reporting
description: Statistical analyses and clinical study reports for clinical trials and registries
Contact: Stefanie Hayoz, Head of Statistics; stefanie.hayoz@sakk.ch

name: Statistical support for publications
description: Statistical support for publications of clinical trials and registries, including tables, figures and methodological parts
Contact: Stefanie Hayoz, Head of Statistics; stefanie.hayoz@sakk.ch

name: PPI services
description: Input to study design, feasibility, trial summary for website

name: PPI services
description: Lay summary of trial results

name: Safety management / Pharmacovigilance
description: Overall safety management of clinical trials, including SAE analysis, writing narratives, evaluate SAEs, declare/write/report SUSARs, risk/benefit assessments, DSURs/ASRs, 7day-a-week service

name: GCP Refreshers, CRC/CTN trainings
description: swissethics approved GCP refresher trainings for Investigators/CRCs/CTNs, One-Day training of CRCs/CTNs on clinical trial conduct at the sites

name: Site Audits
description: Site audits (e.g. routine trial audit, general site audits, Phase I qualification audits, for cause audits…)

name: Vendor qualification/audit
description: qualification analysis of vendors, from SOP/process reviews up to audits (e.g. prewhole saler, CROs)

name: Quality Management of trials
description: Review/Support protocol and other trial tool development in accordance with current QA standards, review deviation reports, management and reporting of serious breaches, including creation/management/review/fup of CAPA plans

name: Education / Training
description: Organization of oncology conferences, specific trainings for CRCs, Young Oncology Academy, educational events on PPI

name: Collaboration with pharmaindustry & biotech companies
description: Industrypool meetings and workshops with the pharmaceutical industry on new research ideas, congresses and further training with the pharmaceutical industry

name: Shaping the Health Care System
description: Enable access to working groups with Swissmedic on the approval of new drugs and clinical trials, enable access to working groups with the FOPH on the pricing of oncologics, access to all working groups in the Cancer Care Community

name: Monitoring risk evaluation and monitoring plan
description: Trial risk evaluation, definition of risk based monitoring strategy, monitoring plan

name: Oncolgic trial proposal support, budget estimations and maintenace
description: Budget estimation for oncological trial proposals and feasibility assessments

name: Biobank Governance review (SBP Label VITA)
description: Evaluation of the Biobank Governance through SBP VITA label as per the applicable Ethical and Legal requirements (e.g. Human Research Act, Taipei Declaration, CM/Rec(2016)6).

name: Governance documents for biobanks (i.e. Biobank Regulation, MTA and consent)
description: Provision of support in creating these governance documents

name: Biobank Information Management System (BIMS)
description: This IT tool supports the biobanks and the biobank infrastructures in the operational daily management of their samples. This tool integrates SBP datasets to foster sample exchange and biobank interoperability. In this regard, SBP has developed two modules (SMPL), a workflow management module and a workflow configuration module which can be integrated into different BIMS solutions (e.g. eLabNext). The implementation of such a solution requires SBP to define the biobank needs and operational aspects through a business analysis and to support the biobank in the proper configuration of its sample management (including storage, legacy data import, workflow management, acess roles, ID and kit management).

name: SBP datasets (human liquid, human tissue, bacteria, veterinary)
description: These datasets provide support towards standardized documentation practice to foster interoperability and data quality with a focus on sample-related data (mainly the documentation of preanalytical data)

name: Biobank practices review (focus on biobanking processes)
description: Evaluation of the Biobank Quality processes through SBP NORMA label as per the relevant professional standards (e.g ISO 20387).

name: Biobank practices review (focus on Quality Management System and Quality Asssurance) / Preparation to the ISO 20387 accreditation for biobanks
description: Evaluation of the Biobank Quality processes through SBP OPTIMA label as per the relevant professional standards (e.g ISO 20387, ISO 9001).

name: SBP library / quality documents
description: Support to develop the biobank quality strategy and related documents for proper sample management. This service also includes the update of existing documents or services (e.g. labels) or the development of new deliverables (incl. guidelines, documentations, datasets) to help CH biobanks work according to state-of-the-art practices.

name: Guidance on Data Quality Management including support to develop a SNSF Data management Plan.
description: This SOP provides guidance towards the implementation of a data quality strategy for biobanks, including the measures implemented to guarantee data integrity, privacy, security and protection as well as data quality.

name: CAS in biobanking (differences between modules)
description: Training with knowledge in biobanking provided in 3 modules (1. Introduction to biobanking, 2. Implementation of biobanking processes and 3. Professional management of a biobank)

name: Easy Guide for Clinical Studies (Easy GCS) - biobanking module
description: Practical reference to handle biobanking activities in the context of clinical studies, provides targeted and concise information on specific subjects (e.g. Protocols, Ethics and Law, Data Handling, etc) within a defined study phase (from Conception to Completion).

name: Harmonized cost model for biobank infrastructure
description: Harmonization of cost-related practices among infrastructures through provision of a template with the list and type (direct vs indirect) of costs that could be applied for the different services proposed by the biobank infrastructures (e.g. sample collection, processing, storage, distribution).

name: SBP Directory and sample catalog (SBP NExT)
description: Promotion of biobanks' visibility through SBP Directory and sample access using specific search criteria in SBP sample Catalog (SBP NExT)

name: Biosafety assessment for microbiology biobanks
description: Evaluation of the Biosafety concept developed by microbiology biobanks, as per the ContainO ordinance.

name: Legal guidance for sharing non-human genetic material
description: Legal guidance for access and sharing of non-human genetic material from national and international sources (Nagoya protocol)

name: Collaboration with BBMRI-ERIC, the European research infrastructure for biobanking
description: SBP is the representative for Switzerland within  BBMRI-ERIC. Through BBMRI, SBP provides its biobanks access to BBMRI services in ELSI, Quality and IT. This tight collaboration enables SBP to propose its biobanks a strategy and documents harmonized across the different National Nodes as well as facilitate collaborations with european and international initiatives.

name: Promotion of the Swiss network in the European Directory of biobanks
description: Entry of biobanks- and sample-data in the BBMRI directory to increase SBP biobanks' network visibility as well as sample collections at the european level  (https://directory.bbmri-eric.eu/ERIC/directory/#/catalogue)

name: Implementation of preanalytical support and sample quality control
description: SBP develops a sample quality strategy for biobanks in collaboration with other European nodes to benefit from already developed expertise including a service of proficiency testing to ensure biobanks' sample quality. This service includes the provision of guidance for sample processing to prepare human DNA or RNA from whole blood or from FFPE samples.

name: Monitoring of biobank Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
description: To promote biobanks' sustainability, SBP in collaboration with BBMRI monitors Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) of biobanks to better understand the actual situation regarding sample access, research collaborations at the Swiss national and European level, the impact of communication and education as well as gather more information on the sustainability of biobanks and quality.

name: Clinical study/project management from preparation, recruitement to participant retention
description:
Study protocol, design, planning  & document development (incl. Trial Master File / Investigator Site File set up and maintenance).
Site preparation, initiation, coordination & management, including:  Internal and external team management with training, project plans, planning of timelines,  patient recruitement and retention.

name: Data science support
description: Technical & semantic data interoperability and regulatory compliance, integration of data from different sources including clinical routine or making the health data of the hospital available for further use in research projects, support for data transfer, R package to import data

name: Statistic training, tools and guidance
description: Training in statistic, tools and guidance, tutorial, workshop

name: PPI services
description: Consulting on which and how to implement patient and public involvement (PPI) measures for research project. Support in formulating PPI Plans for funding requests, and implementation of PPI activities
URL:
https://dkf.unibas.ch/en/services/patient-and-public-involvement/

all other CTUs have such services too but they are not yet apparent on the respective CTU websites
Contact: specific to each CTU

name: PPI resources & Training
description: Guidance and templates on patients and the general public inclusion  to increase the relevance of a research study + training for IICT and implementation of PPI activities, jointly offered by SNSF and SCTO, connection to patient representatives.
Contact: Tamara Kohler, Cordula Landgraf

name: Software (R) statistic packages for efficient Data Management
description: SecuTrial(R) and  REDCap(R) statistic packages performing data transformation /dates,  times etc... to reduce data preparation  for the analytical phase.
Contact:
DM Platfrom coordinator (Tanja Litke)
STAT Platform coordinators (Marie Roumet, Arnaud Künzli)

name: Support and training for databases development
description: Support and training to set up your own database  in RedCap
Contact: specific to each CTU

name: Training on/or database implementation in REDCap and Secutrial
description: Developement and hosting of secure study database (REDCap, REDCap light  or secuTrial), eCRF Design, reporting and visualization, including  data import into database
Contact: CTU Bern, CTU Geneva, CTU Lausanne, CTU Zurich (CTC_DataManagement@usz.ch)

name: Publication/ guidelines and guidance on Regulatory affairs topics
description: Publication and resources on RA/ELSI : stakeholders' perspectives, guidance on new law or law modification, RA watch publication and  different guidance on RA burden for  research projects.
Contact: RA Platform coordinator (currently Güliz Vanil Jaccard)

name: Data management support for the  whole life cycle of data under HRA research  project
description:
Support to the whole data lifecycle for clinical research purposes including: Data Management, data export and archiving, testing, deployment, closure & archiving, preparation and de-identifcation of data for data sharing, user management, storage.
Support & guidance for data governance, access policy  and interfaces to other RI
Contact: specific to each CTU

name: Quality Management consulting, support and development
description:
Advices, support and implementation of quality management system including corrective and preventive action development and risk assesment, with the provision of various templates.
Review of existing documentation (SOPs, TMF, training material,..) in alignment with inspection scope, quality review (gap evaluation) of existing QMS and study materials.
Contact: specific to each CTU

name: Tool (Easy GCS) providing advice and teaching on all aspects of clinical research studies
description: Tool Easy Guide to CLinical Studies (EGCS - https://www.easy-gcs.ch) offering  guidance, advice and teaching on all aspects and for all phases of clinical research projects (HRO and ClinO). The tool connects researchers with experts able to provide professional support.
URL:
https://www.easy-gcs.ch/entrypage.html
(soon above link to be replaced by link on Tools & Resources website)
Contact: PM Platform coordinator (Synove Otterbech)

name: Quality management and audits
description:
Inspection preparation support:  System, process and GCP audits and support in writting inspection reports.
Conducting clinical study audits, at the request of the sponsor or sponsor-investigator: Examination of processes  and the fullfillement to  the required standards

name: Auditing support and tools
description: Internal CTUs audits- GCP compliance, developement of practical tools for the systematic self-assessment of clinical research project, including risk Assessment Form to  assess clinical research project's potential risks.
Contact: AUD Platform coordinator (Anja Eskat, currently Sandra Weber)

name: Monitoring advice and support for clinical trials
description: Data monitoring : providing quality control and assurance for clinical studies (all phases) and HRO projects. Central data monitoring: checks of accumulating study data (in collaboration with Statistic and Data Management platforms)
Contact: specific to each CTU

name: Monitoring tools: tools, templates and guidance for monitoring tasks ensuring data quality
description: Study risk evaluation: tools for risk assessment and monitoring strategy, guidance documents and templates to conduct monitoring of a clinical study (single-centre and multicentered) for interventional studies
Contact: MON Platform coordinator (Jocelyne Chabert, CTU-GE)

name: Safety templates, documents, training and Safety Expert Finder
description:
Guidance documents and templates regarding safety reporting TO DELETE provided by the SCTO SAF Platform, list of skilled safety experts to contact for advice (Safety Expert Finder)
Link to safety experts (Safety Expert Finder) and online training on safety in research projects
Contact: Elena Porro (CTU-EOC Lugano, Safety Platform coordinator)

name: Support for safety issues and reporting
description: Patient management, study medication, consulting regarding safety issues and safety reporting (including templates) for clinical research project
Contact: specific to each CTU

name: Safety tool to report standardized adverse events and reporting
description: IT tools and support for Medical Monitoring of Safety Data, (S)AE reconciliation, narratives, reporting  and MedDRA coding
Contact: Elena Porro (CTU-EOC Lugano, Safety Platform coordinator)

name: Support in statistic & tools for calculation of sample size and  robustness of studies
description: Performs sample size calculation, feasibility check and  diverses statistical analyses (incl. Templates) for clinical research studies
Contact: STAT Platform coordinators (Marie Roumet, Arnaud Künzli)

name: Statistical support
description: Statistical consultancy in research/studies design, methodology, feasibility,recruitment size, statistical analysis  of results, generation and implementation of randomization sequence in study database
Contact: specific to each CTU

name: Regulatory Affairs consulting and support for all types of research projects falling under HRA ((ClinO(-MD) and HRO)
description: Legal support for research projects, use of general consent, risk classification. Regulatory review of study documents (patient information sheet & consent...) and submissions to ethics committees and regulatory authorities (EC,  Swissmedic and abroad, CTIS) for all type of projects under HRA & over the entire project life cycle.
Contact: specific to each CTU

regional infrastructure: CTU Network/STCO EDU Platform with Unimedswiss
name: Postgraduate training source on clinical research and HRO research projects
description: Database of postgraduate training options in clinical research (includes short courses, CAS, MAS, etc.), funding opportunities and communication (forum, symposium and CR carrer website) on different topics regarding clinical research -> https://cr-careers.ch/
Contact: Melanie Glaettli (EDU Platorfm coordinator)

name: Training on Clinical trials and Research projects
description: Continuous training and advanced training courses in the field of human research & Clinical Reasearch, GCP, GCP refresher, ClinO (-MD), HRO Research projects
Contact: Verena Golz  (DKF Basel), CTU Zurich (CTC-Education@usz.ch)

name: Research infrastructures to conduct patients examination for Clinical trials or HRO projects
description: Provision of Infrastructures : fully equipped patient rooms, and/or storage of study drugs and samples.

name: Clinical research nursing services
description: Provision of competent study personnel: nurses, medical doctors and coordinators for recruiting, management of study documentation and monitoring of research participants during clinical trials + Biobank/laboratory services to process and store samples

name: Budgeting tool to manage & calculate site costs
description: Budget estimation and feasibility support, budget management

name: Support for submission to IICT call & study registration
description: Submission support to researchers for applying to IICT SNSF call to  conduct a multicenter randomized-controlled trial.

name: Coordination with ECRIN, multicentre studies within Europe
description:
SCTO is the representative for Switzerland within the ECRIN-ERIC and host the ECRIN’s European Correspondent who serves as the national point of contact. Through ECRIN, SCTO provides its SCTO Network access to ECRIN management, consultancy services,  tools and to multicentric studies in Europe.

TO DELETE PREVIOUS TEXT : Coordination of  multicentric studies in Europe. EU Coordinator at the SCTO EO is the representative for Switzerland within  European Research Infrastructure Network (ECRIN). Through SCTO, researchers have access to ECRIN management and consultancy services. Promotion of  international partnerships and multicentre studies

name: Coordination with SwissPedNet network
description: Coordination of pediatric clincial research in Switzerland. SCTO EO hosts the SwissPedNet coordinator.

name: Clinical research advocacy
description: Advocate for a Favorable Clinical Framework by: 1/ Responding to early consultations with authorities using SCTO Network's broad expertise. 2/Taking clear positions on clinical research issues. 3/Consulting national authorities via roundtable discussions. 4/Representing Switzerland in the European ECRIN-ERIC network.

name: Single-point of contact in each UH for data availability and access
description: Processing of requests for access/transfer of (real-world) data from UH, consulting for data sharing/collaboration strategy

name: ELSI helpdesk
description:
1. Support for complying with requirements from Ethics Committees (ECs) and data producers for concluding a contractual framework specifiying the responsibilities, processes, and infrastructures related to data processing and data sharing in multi-site collaborative projects and for data reuse by 3rd parties.
2. Support for GC related issues, procedural questions/coordination, regulatory strategy for multi-center data-driven projects
3. Coordination of nation-wide harmonization of templates and processes related to the above.
Contact:
Dr. Julia Maurer, Head SPHN/DCC ELSI helpdesk, Scientific Coordination Manager
julia.maurer@sib.swiss

name: Guidelines for ethical data sharing in public-private partnerships
description:
Ethical guidelines for project leaders intending to negotiate and establishg public-private partnerships (PPPs) giving access to data collected or curated within a publicly funded project.
These guidelines supplement the legal agreements (CA, DTUA, DTPA) and help adapting the templates for PPPs, on a principal/general guidance level

name: BioMedIT training: Research with Sensitive Data (12 courses)
description: Webinar/online training on research with sensitive data and information security aspects

name: Guidelines for the return of actionable findings
description: Ethical guidelines for principal investigators

name: Ethical framework for the responsible processing of health-related data
description: Ethical framework for processing and sharing of health-related data.

name: SPHN Dataset (semantic framework)
description:
Provision of a harmonized framework for the semantic description of health-related data (Concepts)

Collection of requirements from the research community/projects and building a national consensus for semantic data definitions.

Terminology service

name: SPHN RDF Schema
description: Providision of a standardized framework for the storage and transport of health-related data with minimal information loss

name: SPHN Connector
description: Facilitation of the transformation of different, SPHN-compliant data formats into RDF

name: BioMedIT training: FAIR Health Data for Research (11 courses)
description: Webinar/online training

name: Data Management Plan Guideline
description: Guideline and supporting consultancy on how to complete the SNSF DMP template for multi-centric research projects with sensitive health data
Contact: ? (DCC)

name: Data Management services for Big Data analysis
description: Provision of DM tools OpenBIS, Labkey, SLIMS, GraphDB, Renku (on BioMedIT)

name: BioMedIT
description:
Secure IT environment (HPC) enabling collaborative processing and analysis of data. End-to-end secure processing ensured from data provider to analysis,
IT services and related research support (e.g. data management)

name: BioMedIT training: Responsible Use of Health-Related Data for Research (2 courses) covering mostly ELSI aspects
description: Webinar/online training

name: BioMedIT training: Information Security, data protection (5 courses)
description: Webinar/online training

name: DEAS - Feasibility
description: Queries delivering aggregate results (patient numbers, age and gender distribution) across the 5 UH and KiSpi for a defined set of clinical parameters (SPHN dataset)

name: DEAS - Data Exploration
description: Provision of an encrypted IT platform for federated data exploration (value averages and distribution, survival curves) across the 5 UH and KiSpi for a defined set of clinical parameters (SPHN dataset)

name: University hospital research data platforms (Clinical Data Platform, CDP)
description: Provision of real-world data in SPHN-compliant formats

name: Metadata service (standards) providing computer-based access to FAIR data points and repositories
description: Provision of standards allowing data (e.g. on a website) to be readable and accessible by a computer

name: Guidelines for ethically responsible sharing of genomic data
description: Guidance for processing and sharing of genomic data

name: Public-private (P2) collaboration framework
description: Consortium providing results of data analyses to industry (and other) partners

name: Metadata catalog
description: Catalog of all data elements present in the National Data Stream and other projects
